intro: Microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and aromatic foliage, which often contain compounds similar to those found in parsley and carrots. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Microsperma species are often found in woodland or meadow habitats, where they contribute to biodiversity. Due to their subtle appearance, they are sometimes overlooked but play an important role in supporting pollinators and soil health.
